title: Leading Global Investor
description: In 2023, Japan's foreign direct investment reached $170.58 billion, marking it as one of the highest in the world.

title: High Net Primary Income
description: Japan's net primary income from abroad was $257.89 billion in 2023, showcasing its strong global economic ties.

title: Tokyo: World's Largest City
description: As of 2024, Tokyo's population reached 37.12 million, making it the largest city globally.

title: High Domestic Credit Provision
description: In 2023, Japan's domestic credit provided by the financial sector was 380.17% of its GDP, indicating a robust financial system.

title: Significant Central Government Debt
description: Japan's central government debt was 216.21% of GDP in 2022, one of the highest globally, posing economic challenges.

title: Strong Educational Progression
description: In 2016, Japan achieved a 99.99% progression rate to secondary school, reflecting its commitment to education.

title: Aging Population
description: In 2023, 7.18% of Japan's female population and 6.87% of its male population were aged 70-74, highlighting an aging demographic.

title: Low Lending Interest Rate
description: In 2017, Japan had a lending interest rate of 0.994%, one of the lowest globally, making borrowing more affordable for businesses and consumers.

title: Minimal Youth Unemployment
description: In 2019, only 3.14% of Japanese youth were not in education, employment, or training, reflecting strong youth engagement in productive activities.

title: Low Male Youth Disengagement
description: As of 2019, Japan had a low percentage of male youth not in education, employment, or training, at just 2.73%, indicating effective youth policies.

title: Competitive Real Effective Exchange Rate
description: In 2023, Japan's real effective exchange rate index stood at 58.11, enhancing its export competitiveness by making Japanese goods more affordable abroad.

title: Low Bound Rate for Manufactured Products
description: Japan's bound rate for manufactured products was 2.49% in 2021, promoting trade by keeping tariffs low and encouraging imports.

title: Low Compensation of Employees
description: In 2022, compensation of employees accounted for only 4.90% of expenses, suggesting a potential area for improvement in wage distribution.

title: Youth Engagement Challenge
description: Projected for 2024, 3.121% of Japanese youth are expected not to be in education, employment, or training, highlighting a need for continued focus on youth programs.
